net.sf.opengroove.client.notification
Class NotificationAdapter

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.client.notification.NotificationAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaskbarNotification
public class NotificationAdapter
extends Object
implements TaskbarNotification

a TaskbarNotification that returns the component passed to the constructor,and the status as to whether it is an alert. If clicked() is not overridden, the notification will be dismissed when it is clicked.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

Constructor Detail

NotificationAdapter

public NotificationAdapter(TaskbarNotificationFrame frame,
                           Component component,
                           boolean isAlert,
                           boolean isOneTimeOnly)
Creates a new notification adapter.

Parameters:
frame - The parent frame for this adapter. This is only required if clicked() is not overridden.
component - The component to display for this notification adapter.
isAlert - True if this is an alert (in which case the taskbar icon will flash when this item is in the taskbar notification frame), false if not.
isOneTimeOnly - True if this is a one-time-only alert, which means that it will be automatically dismissed the next time that the notification frame is hidden.

NotificationAdapter

public NotificationAdapter(TaskbarNotificationFrame frame,
                           Component component,
                           boolean isAlert)
Method Detail

clicked

public void clicked()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
called when this alert is clicked. the component returned from getComponent() has a mouse listener added to it and when it is clicked then this method is called. an alternate way to listen for click events would be to add a mouse listener to the component returned yourself.

Specified by:
clicked in interface TaskbarNotification

getComponent

public Component getComponent()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
this method should return the component that should be placed in the notification frame. it is imperative that this method return the same component each time this method is called. it is also imperative that the component never change size.

Specified by:
getComponent in interface TaskbarNotification
Returns:

isAlert

public boolean isAlert()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
returns true if this is an alert. if this is an alert, the taskbar icon will flash while this is in the notification frame. basically, an alert is intended to alert the user that they need to click on the component, for example, a message has been received. an example of a NON alert would be a notification about that the message is in progress of sending to someone else.

Specified by:
isAlert in interface TaskbarNotification
Returns:

mouseOut

public void mouseOut()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
called when the mouse moves out of this alert.

Specified by:
mouseOut in interface TaskbarNotification

mouseOver

public void mouseOver()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
called when the mouse moves over this alert.

Specified by:
mouseOver in interface TaskbarNotification

isOneTimeOnly

public boolean isOneTimeOnly()
Description copied from interface: TaskbarNotification
returns true if this alert is one time only. If an alert is one time only, then it will be removed from the TaskbarNotificationFrame when it fades out. an example of a one time only alert might be that so-and-so has just come online.

Specified by:
isOneTimeOnly in interface TaskbarNotification
Returns:
